title: How Two of the Rarest Horses on Earth Got Lost
excerpt: The entire world’s population of Przewalski’s horses once dwindled to a mere dozen. So how did a pair named Fiona and Shrek end up in livestock auctions in the West?

title: The Portuguese shepherds who love wolves
excerpt: Whilst Europe grapples with how to deal with growing wolf populations, this mountainous region of Portugal has coexisted with the predators for centuries.

title: How a Crisis for Vultures Led to a Human Disaster: Half a Million Deaths
excerpt: The birds were accidentally poisoned in India. New research on what happened next shows how wildlife collapse can be deadly for people.

title: The Rise Of The Bee Bandits
excerpt: Where once there was cattle and horse rustling, the American West is now confronting the theft of its bees.

title: The unique songbird that's gone forever
excerpt: Bachman’s warbler is one of 21 species declared extinct last year – but scientists are still discovering its secrets

title: Earth League International Hunts the Hunters | The New Yorker
excerpt: A conservation N.G.O. infiltrates wildlife-trafficking rings to bring them down.

title: The Trillion-Dollar Auction to Save the World
excerpt: Ocean creatures soak up huge amounts of humanity’s carbon mess. Should we value them like financial assets?

title: My Rancher Parents Hate Wolves. I Took Them on a Yellowstone Wolf-Watching Tour to Change Their Minds.
excerpt: Wolves are my favorite animal, but my parents see them as the enemy that kills their livestock

title: Branding With Bonobos? A Conservation Fee Might Help Save Them.
excerpt: Data suggests brands can blunt public awareness of species loss when they use at-risk animals in ads. Should they pay?

title: Killing Invasive Species Is Now a Competitive Sport
excerpt: In the Panhandle, where swarms of lionfish gobble up native species, a tournament offers cash prizes to divers skilled at spearing one predator after another.

title: Into the Forbidden Forest
excerpt: Famed American biologist Patricia Wright explores an astonishing breadth of biodiversity in the wilderness of Madagascar

title: Romance, Politics, and Ecological Damage: The Saga of Sable Island’s Wild Horses | Hakai Magazine
excerpt: They’ve roamed free for hundreds of years, but is that freedom harming the ecosystem they call home?

title: The Kenyan Maasai Who Once Hunted Lions Are Now Their Saviors
excerpt: A decade ago, scientists worried the lion could go extinct in Kenya by 2020. But today the area’s lion population is thriving thanks to an extraordinary group.
